header.title: PRACTICAL MAGICKAL EVOCATION
header.category: Western Esotericism, Grimoire Magic, Practical Magic, Occultism

central_thesis: The book presents a practical, operative system of magic designed to alter the physical plane and personal circumstances through spells, spirit evocation, and psychic energy manipulation. It emphasizes the practitioner's personal will, belief, and confidence as the primary drivers for achieving material and emotional desires, while also offering methods for personal and property protection and repulsion of negative influences.

structure_content.summary: Introduces practical magic as a means to change the physical plane and achieve material comforts, stressing the importance of personal will, belief, and patience for manifestation.

A ritual for financial needs, involving writing a desired sum and personal details on paper, soaking it in orange juice, placing it at the heart chakra, burning it with a specific chant to 'spirits of money,' and scattering the ashes.
A spell to increase luck in money matters and gambling, invoking the entities Ra and Venus. It is to be performed facing the sun on a Friday and repeated the following Sunday.

A ritual for a steady flow of money or windfalls, utilizing spring water, a clear glass, and green paper inscribed with 'MMIM' (Money Magnetism Is Mine). It involves affirmations and drinking charged water for purification and wealth attraction.
Discusses magic's ability to influence emotional states, emphasizing ethical considerations and the impact on free-will when performing spells to alter another person's feelings.

A ritual for attracting love or a specific person, using a fresh rose (or any flower), a pink candle inscribed with names, and two pieces of paper. It involves chanting, visualization, burning the candle out, and burying the rose with the wrapped papers.

A ritual designed for attracting a physical liaison without emotional entanglement. It uses a red candle for 'sexual pleasure' and a black candle inscribed with the person's name and 'sex,' accompanied by chants to Mars and visualization of desires.

A self-improvement spell to enhance personal attraction and confidence. It involves bathing with a Venus-ruled essential oil (Patchouli or Ylang-Ylang), using a cloth to rub away negativity, visualizing a green glow, and affirming 'the light of love'.

A spell to end an unwanted love affair. It requires a piece of clothing from one partner, a nettle, heavily salted water, and pepper. The nettle is wrapped in the clothing, buried, and the mixture poured over it with specific incantations.

A spell to inflict bad luck on an enemy, utilizing an item of their clothing, heavily salted water, pepper, and tobacco from a used cigarette. It involves mixing these components, chanting to 'Demons and spirits of hell,' burying the item, and pouring the liquid over it.

A protective spell to deter unwanted guests. It uses ordinary talcum powder and dried tobacco, infused with visualized red energy, and charged with a chant to create a 'mystical talismanic powder' which is then spread around the home's entrances.
Acknowledges psychic attacks as a real but rare danger in occult practice, dispelling exaggerated notions of demonic possession and satanic rituals.

A meditative ritual for psychic self-defense and aura cleansing, performed regularly. It involves deep breathing, visualization of white light encompassing the body, and expelling 'small black clouds' of negativity.

Methods to protect personal belongings, home, and car using psychic energy. It involves visualization of protective white energy and specific affirmations to safeguard against negativity, theft, and harm.

Introduces the art of summoning and commanding 'demons,' which are interpreted as 'representations of our own psyches' rather than infernal entities. It explains their purpose to serve man and the importance of proper execution.
Details the preparation of a ritual space, or 'temple,' by placing an altar/table in the center, along with drawings of the demon's sigil, the book itself, and incense.

Describes the creation of two protective circles for evocation: a physical salt circle (ideally 9 feet) and a visualized astral golden circle. It details the process of walking the circle, cleansing chants, and placing incense outside for the demon.

Provides a specific evocation ritual for the spirit Aseliel, aimed at making the practitioner more attractive or securing love. It involves a wand (or fingers), visualizing a blue triangle outside the circle for the demon's appearance, holding Aseliel's sigil, and performing complex conjurations using divine names. Includes instructions for warning and compelling a reluctant spirit.

Crucial instructions for formally dismissing an evoked spirit after its task is given. It includes a specific chant and methods to employ if the spirit refuses to leave, emphasizing the necessity of this step for safety.

An evocation ritual for the spirit Bydiel, intended to teach occult techniques and provide an advantage in magical knowledge. The method is identical to Aseliel's evocation, with only the spirit's name substituted.

Describes evocations for Emoniel (for general purposes or when no specific demon fits) and Usiel (for finding hidden money and valuables). Both use the same general evocation rites with their respective sigils and names.
An evocation for Icosiel, a slave spirit or familiar, to provide advice and execute tasks. It specifies Icosiel's sigil and that its servants often do the bidding through it.
An evocation for the spirit Maseriel, who teaches about the arts of magic, necromancy, and philosophy. It specifies Maseriel's sigil and that its servants aid in the quest for enlightenment.

key_concepts.definition: A system focused on tangible, operative changes in the physical plane and personal life, emphasizing results rather than abstract spiritual development.
The central driving force behind all magical manifestation, requiring focus, belief, and confidence to impress upon the physical plane.
Psychic energy centers within the body, specifically the heart chakra, which is identified as having a direct influence over one's finances.
The act of summoning and commanding spirits ('demons') to appear and perform specific tasks for the magician.

In this context, 'demons' are defined as 'representations of our own psyches' or 'demons of the mind,' rather than traditional infernal entities, but they are still capable of physical manifestation and obedience.
A unique magical symbol representing a specific spirit. Holding and visualizing a spirit's sigil during evocation is presented as a method to compel its appearance and obedience.

Protective barriers used during evocation. The physical circle is formed from salt (ideally 9 feet in diameter), while the astral circle is visualized as a strong golden beam surrounding the practitioner, both designed to ensure safety from the evoked entity.
A visualized or physical triangular space, positioned outside the magical circle, where the evoked spirit is commanded to appear 'in fair and human shape, without deformity, horror or delay'.
The formal and crucial ritual dismissal of an evoked spirit after it has received its instructions, ensuring it leaves without causing harm and preventing unwanted attachments.
A real but rare danger within occult practice, referring to malicious energetic assaults sent by other practitioners, which necessitates protective measures.
Rituals or meditations designed to remove everyday negativity and 'pick-up' from the practitioner's energetic field (aura), thereby enhancing personal well-being and magical efficacy.
Key techniques employed in many spells, involving mental imaging and spoken or internal declarations to direct psychic energy, charge objects, and manifest desires.
The principle that a psychic attack sent against a protected individual will not only fail but will return to the sender with increased strength, specifically 'threefold'.

practical_system.description: The system presented is an eclectic, operative framework combining elements of ceremonial magic, folk magic, and psychological techniques. It operates on the principle that focused will, belief, and confidence can manifest desired changes in the physical plane. Simpler spells utilize natural elements, visualization, and affirmations, while evocation rituals integrate grimoire-style conjurations (invoking divine names) with a psychological reinterpretation of 'demons' as aspects of the practitioner's own psyche. Central to the system is robust protection through both physical (salt) and astral (visualized energy) circles during evocations. The system emphasizes direct action and tangible results, offering a pragmatic path for practitioners.

relevant_quotes.text: Practical Magick is designed to change the physical plane, in order to bring it under your 'will'.
There is nothing evil or selfish about wanting the good things in life.
Sometimes it can take what seems like a long time for a spell to manifest, but be patient and don't lose heart, it once took two months for a particularly delicate spell to manifest for me.
These demons, once called, must obey a human such is the law of the universe.
I call to thee, Oh spirit Aseliel, by the power of almighty God, I conjure thee, and command thee by Adonay, Agla, Jehova.

Demons and spirits of hell, Charge this with your venomous spit. Fill it with the negativity of your realm, Make him suffer slowly, no, not too quick. Take my hatred from whence it spawned, Bad luck is his from dusk to dawn. SO MOTE IT BE.

Oh spirit Aseliel, because thou hast answered my demands I hereby license thee to depart, without injury to man or beast. GO I tell you, go, but come thee back whenever I summon thee by the force of holy magick!

critical_analysis.relevance: M. McGrath's 'Practical Magickal Evocation' provides a highly pragmatic and results-oriented approach to magic, blending elements of traditional grimoire magic with modern occult and New Age concepts. Its relevance lies in offering direct, actionable rituals for material, emotional, and personal protection, which appeals to a broad range of contemporary practitioners. The text demystifies evocation by interpreting 'demons' as aspects of the psyche while retaining the ceremonial structure of classical grimoire work. This synthesis makes complex practices more accessible, particularly for those focused on tangible outcomes and personal empowerment. The inclusion of protective and banishing spells alongside manifestation rituals highlights a well-rounded, albeit simplified, operative magical system.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The book is primarily targeted at novice to intermediate practitioners of Western Esotericism and Occultism who are seeking practical, results-driven magic. It appeals to individuals interested in improving their financial situation, romantic life, sexual experiences, personal magnetism, and general safety. Those looking for a hands-on manual that provides clear steps for spells and a simplified introduction to spirit evocation, without requiring extensive theoretical background or adherence to rigid dogmas, would find this text particularly useful. The emphasis on personal will and confidence also resonates with a self-empowerment demographic.
